quest.name: Best Served Foul
journal:
Zukin is in a stink over an attack on a caravan.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
objectives: Speak with the cranky Kojin on the Isle of Bekko.
Seek out Red Kojin and smear them with golden aspic upon their defeat.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: The Red, Forename─they have fallen upon one of our caravans!

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: By the grace of the kami, we were able to protect the goods, but the Red brigands remain at large. I need you to join us in hunting them down.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Once you have found and given them a trouncing, smear this all over them. Golden aspic, it is called, and it is made by─actually, 'tis best that you do not know. The point is it smells foul, and will serve to teach the offending Reds a lesson.

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, one of our sisters is scouring the Isle of Bekko for them. Seek her out first, and she will tell you more.

dialogue.name: KOJINFEMALE02979
dialogue.text: The Red brigands struck fast, but they fled even faster. If you would search the northern shoreline, I will see to the rest of the isle.

dialogue.name: KOJINFEMALE02979
dialogue.text: And as Zukin will have told you, after you subdue the villains, you are to smear golden aspic all over them. Do not forget this step.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Hmph! And I was so close to the water!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: What the─ Uhhh... I'm going to be─ Hurrrgh!

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Were you able to find and punish the Red in the manner prescribed?

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: Haha, well done, my friend! Our comrades shall be pleased to learn that you have dealt with the brigands!

dialogue.name: ZUKIN
dialogue.text: The poor sods will reek for a good while, and until such time as the odor fades, they are like to be spurned by their own. A fine lesson, yes?
